a state of conflict; a war.
the young of any animal.
the tree Spondias pinnata of Anacardiaceae family.
its plum; Indian hog-plum.
a yellow or brownish-yellow translucent, hard, easily polished and quickly electrified by friction, fossil resin found along some seacoasts and used in jewellery, pipestems, etc.; amber.
= ಅಂಬರಚರ.
= ಅಂಬಲಗೊಟ್ಟಗೆ.
an enclosed place adjoining a house or a temple; a yard.
= ಅಂಬಲಿ.
a place where the village counsellors, authorised or informal body, meet for deliberation.
the tree Radermachera xylocarpa ( = Stereospermum xylocarpium) of Bignoniaceae family; trumpet tree.
a kind of meal made of rice, ragi or jowar flour and boiling water and, often, buttermilk; a porridge.
the water with which rice is washed before it is cooked;

ಅಂಬಲಿ ಕುಡಿಯುವವನಿಗೆ ಮೀಸೆ ತಿಕ್ಕುವವನೊಬ್ಬ ambali kuḍiyuvavanige mīse tikkuvavanobba (prov.) a beggar wants a servant to serve him; he who has no bread to spare should not keep a dog; ಅಂಬಲಿತುಂಬೆಸೊಪ್ಪು ತಿನ್ನು ambali tumbesoppu tinnu (fig.) to have food of low standard owing to unaffordability.
a big earthen vessel for porridge.
a piece of agricultural land endowed for meeting basic needs of a person.
